original: ELIASSON, Karl Georg, Civilingenjör, Göteborg, f Halmstad 14/7 84 av byggm Jöns E o Kristina Andersson, gm Solveig Margareta Wahlström. Hmst hal 99, CTH (el) 06, Techn Hochsch Karlsruhe 06—07, Anst Luth & Rosén 07, ass eltekn lab CTH 07—16, prof Fredrik H Lamms eltekn byrå 07—11, El Prövn. anst Gbg 11—12. Eg kons eltekn ing-byrå o eltekn lab sed. 12. Ag fastigh Gbg. Kons ing v elvkn i Varberg, Lysekil, Kungälv, Kungsbacka o Älvsb municipsmh. Styr.led Sv Kons Ing frn, ordf Sv Besiktn.man.frn sekt f eltekn. Resor: Tyskl, Schweiz, Ital, Österr, Frankr, Engl, Danm, Norge, Finl 12—39. Av trycket spec.art i div tekn tidskr o dagl tidn. RVO, ProPstGM, PatrstGM; Odd Fellow, PB, Bachelors’ Club. Hobbies: Pistolskytte, smalfilmning.
translated: ELIASSON, Karl Georg, Civil Engineer, Gothenburg, b. Halmstad 14/7 84 to builder Jöns E and Kristina Andersson, m. Solveig Margareta Wahlström. Moved to Halmstad in 1899, studied at Chalmers University of Technology (electrical engineering) from 1906 to 1907 and at the Technical University of Karlsruhe from 1906 to 1907. Worked at the Luth & Rosén Institution in 1907, assistant at the electrical engineering laboratory at Chalmers University of Technology from 1907 to 1916, professor at Fredrik H Lamm's electrical engineering firm from 1907 to 1911, and at the Electrical Testing Institute in Gothenburg from 1911 to 1912. Owns an electrical engineering consultancy and laboratory since 1912. Also engaged in property businesses in Gothenburg. Consulting engineer for electricity in Varberg, Lysekil, Kungälv, Kungsbacka, and Älvsborg municipalities. Board member of the Swedish Consulting Engineers Association, chairman of the Swedish Inspection-Managers Association in the electrical engineering sector. Traveled to Germany, Switzerland, Italy, Austria, France, England, Denmark, Norway, and Finland from 1912 to 1939. Published articles in various technical journals and newspapers. Awards: Royal Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Knight of the Order of St. Olav; member of Odd Fellow, PB (Bachelors' Club). Hobbies: Shooting with pistols, amateur filmmaking.
